title: MS08-067 / Windows Server Service RCE
context: Remote code execution in the Windows Server service (path canonicalization).
notes: Exploited by Conficker; wormable and widely used against Windows 2003 / XP with many language-pack targets.

title: EternalBlue (SMBv1 remote code execution)
context: SMBv1 remote code execution vulnerability exploited by leaked NSA tooling.
notes: Used in WannaCry and NotPetya campaigns; patch released before public exploit release.

title: Heartbleed (OpenSSL heartbeat over-read)
context: OpenSSL heartbeat implementation allowed reading server memory, leaking keys and secrets.
notes: Wide impact on TLS-enabled services; required key rotation and OpenSSL updates.

title: Shellshock (Bash environment function parsing)
context: Bash parsing flaw allowing code execution via crafted environment variables.
notes: Affected many Unix-like systems where Bash was used; multiple follow-up fixes required.

title: Apache Struts Jakarta Multipart parser RCE
context: Crafted Content-Type (or related header) allowed command execution in Struts 2.
notes: Instrumental in the 2017 Equifax breach when an internet-facing instance went unpatched.

title: BlueKeep (RDP Remote Code Execution)
context: Critical RDP remote code execution in Remote Desktop Services with wormable potential.
notes: Microsoft issued patches and guidance; high concern for legacy, unpatched systems.

title: SMBGhost (SMBv3 compression RCE)
context: SMBv3 handling vulnerability (compression) allowing remote code execution on vulnerable hosts.
notes: Patch and mitigations published; noted for potential wormability.

title: Windows LNK Shortcut Parsing Vulnerability
context: Processing of specially crafted LNK shortcut files leading to arbitrary code execution when icons were rendered.
notes: Used by Stuxnet and other campaigns to propagate via USB to air-gapped systems.

title: ZeroLogon (Netlogon Elevation of Privilege)
context: Cryptographic flaw in Netlogon allowing an attacker to impersonate machines and set empty domain passwords via Netlogon RPC.
notes: High severity; enables domain takeover if domain controllers are reachable and unpatched.

title: MS12-020 / RDP Use-After-Free (DoS, implied RCE attempts)
context: RDP use-after-free causing DoS; public discussion and Metasploit research explored potential RCE paths but public, reliable RCE was not documented.
notes: Popular Metasploit module due to community interest and research activity; primarily a DoS in public disclosures.

title: MS06-040 / NetpwPathCanonicalize Overflow
context: Server service path canonicalization overflow allowing remote code execution on older Windows versions.
notes: No official patch for NT4; useful against legacy systems where NT4 is still present.

title: MS03-026 / RPC DCOM Interface Overflow
context: RPC DCOM buffer overflow enabling remote code execution on older Windows systems.
notes: Used by Blaster and Nachi worms; historically the de-facto reliable exploit for many NT-era machines.

title: MS10-006 / SMB Client Infinite Loop (Windows 7 / Server 2008 R2)
context: SMB client bug that can cause an infinite loop / crash when a client connects to a malicious SMB server.
notes: Client-side DoS demonstrated against Windows 7 / Server 2008 R2; not an RCE.

title: Adobe Reader Embedded EXE (social engineering)
context: Technique embedding and executing a PE inside a PDF to achieve code execution when the PDF is opened.
notes: Used in social-engineering style attacks; popular meterpreter/embedded-PE module for Adobe Reader.

title: Apache mod_isapi <= 2.2.14 Dangling Pointer
context: Dangling pointer vulnerability in mod_isapi leading to DoS on Windows hosts running vulnerable Apache/mod_isapi.
notes: Windows-only impact; generally a DoS rather than RCE.

title: Java AtomicReferenceArray Type Violation
context: Type violation in Java's AtomicReferenceArray exploited as a cross-platform Java RCE affecting vulnerable Java runtimes.
notes: Public exploit demonstrated Meterpreter sessions on Windows, Linux, and macOS for affected Java versions.

title: Authenticated Windows Code Execution (PSExec-style utility use)
context: Post-authenticated remote execution via administrative services (utility module pattern rather than a single bug).
notes: PSExec and similar techniques allow remote command execution when valid credentials with sufficient privileges are available; common in post-exploitation and testing.

title: MS05-039 / Plug and Play Service Overflow
context: Plug and Play service overflow exploited to gain code execution on Windows 2000-era systems.
notes: Used by Zotob and other early worms; historically important for Windows 2000 exploitation.
